lead_paragraph: The opening of the Hudson River Railroad, and the transit from New-York to Albany in the short space of four hours, present a new era in the annals of travel. The steamboats have reigned supreme over the noble waters of the Hudson for forty-four years. It was on September 28, 1807, that FULTON'S boat first undertook the arduous task of statedly ascending the river to the capital, for the transmission of passengers.
